cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, then slowing and turning northwest toward the southeastern Louisiana / Mississippi coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi coast (near the LA-MS border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Indian Pass FL to Ochlockonee River FL (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: East of Ocean Springs MS to Indian Pass FL (Tropical Storm Warning); Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS (Hurricane Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern and northeastern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible in outer rain-bands Sunday night into Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along the immediate west-central Florida coast, little impact inside Tampa Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could bring additional 1–3 inches of rain through Monday, producing brief localized flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous surf and rip currents along west-central Florida beaches
